title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
First of all, I’m writing this review after several months of going back and forth with the HR dept regarding several positions that I applied for over the last year. After reviewing my application, the HR people email asking few questions like” why are you interested in working in MD Anderson and what are the salary expectation”. It is known that the salary ranges for MD Anderson employees (including pharmacy techs) are posted online to help give an idea about salary expectations. So, I asked initially for the mid range (considering that I have a higher education degree, a 1+ year experience as a CPhT, and a strong pharmacy background from being a pharmacist overseas for 6 years). However, the HR did not take these in consideration and offered me a low range salary, which ultimately I agreed on. 
Then it comes to the interview process, which I describe as totally unprofessional and unrespectful at all. They gave me a confirmation letter for an interview that I printed before going there. When I arrived to the HR building, I notified the lady at the front desk but it seemed that she had no idea about my name or anything regarding having an interview with me. I showed her the copy of the confirmation email but she was still confused like nobody told her what was going on. She told me to have a seat till someone from the HR will meet me. I waited for 15 minutes, then a lady from the dept showed up and gave me a map about how to take the the shuttle to go the building where the assistant hiring manager is. So, I took the shuttle and went there. I arrived to the pharmacy at 10 am, which is my interview time, and waited for another 15 minutes until 2 young ladies came and asked me how do I pronounce my name!! They told me to follow them without introducing themselves. I thought that they’re probably employees and would take me to the assistant hiring manager. However, we sat in a lounge like a food court. I asked them about their name and that they did not introduce themselves. They laughed like it was a joke and one of them told me that she is the assistant hiring manager!. After that, they pulled out a few pages describing the position that I applied to, and they started reading out these things to me like I was in elementary school! 
They went over my CV and they said it’s a pretty good one though they don’t require experience in the positions that I applied to but (they would prefer someone who worked in CVS or Walmart, which is not my case !!). I was like then why you guys called me for this interview! You could save time for both of us if I was informed earlier!!
Next they start asking me questions that I felt off subject like “during my work as a technician, was there an incident/mistake that I made and apologized for it!” and “have I been in a situation where I needed advice or help from more than 2 sources at the same time?” .
The interview lasted for 30 minutes, and at the end they offered me a tour inside the pharmacy with one of the techs. I was also told to go back to the HR building because they wanted to interview me there.
 I went back to the HR building and told the lady in the front desk that I’m supposed to be interviewed with somebody in the HR. She told me to have a seat and someone will be with me shortly. However, I waited for 45 minutes without anybody showing up. I really got frustrated by the way the treated me and asked the receptionist to check what is the issue. Few minutes later, a lady showed up saying that she’s sorry but the person who was supposed to interview me is in a meeting now, and she would call me later on that day or the next day (which did not happen)! After being on hold for over than a month waiting for any update regarding my application, they sent me an email finally saying that they didn’t consider me for the two positions I applied to!
To sum up, the experience that I had with these people showing that they are not professional, not respectful and not considerate. I was so eager to work in MD Anderson because of what I heard about their ethics and good reputation, but what I went through with the HR dept and management changed my perspective.
Interview Questions: Irrelevant questions

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
They have serious workflow issue regarding hiring person.
Applied online, directly contacted by the administrative person from the department where the position is and set up a phone screen with a prospective coworker from the same department, got a Web-ex interview with the same team one week after initial interview, after that, interviewed by the boss of the department via Web-ex. The whole interview process was actually great, people are nice and laid back and supportive.
The problem is there was never a chance for the candidate to speak to HR about salary, benefit and other HR related issue. especially the salary part, shouldn't that be the first part of the process so no time from either party would be wasted? As expected, when the HR contacted me, they offered me a very very very disappointing salary and only willing to go as high as my current salary. So no matter how well the interview process is, it's all a total waste of time which can be easily avoided should they have HR contact the candidate first asking about salary, which is a normal insinuation would do.

Really don't understand how they came up this whole work flow especially they have a reputation for offering a less competitive base salary.

If you jump through all of those hopes successfully, HR will call your references and do a job check.  You'll then go through a week long tug o war for counteroffers regarding pay.

title: Research Associate Interview

title: Research H Assistant Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

The interviewers were very pleasant and approachable and even showed humor to break the ice a little bit. It was an excellent experience. Probably the best panel interview I've been through, so far.

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview

title: Research Quality Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Called for an interview by HR person and scheduled over the phone to meet the hiring manager. Arrived in HR and took a shuttle to the department's office. Interviewed by the hiring manager and 2 potential co-workers. They were very impressed with my CV. Called back for a second interview about 2-3 weeks later and interviewed with the boss's boss and the section's leader. Learned that I was now being considered for a higher position and waited an additional month before a third interview where I met 2 more people that I would be working along side and being trained by. At the end of the process... A very long process, there was a job offer. Total time from invitation for first interview to job offer was about 2.5 - 3 months.
Interview Questions: What are your goals?

title: Student Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied through my school, and after a week or two I got a called to schedule an interview. I went to the interview fully prepared. there was lot questions,and be willing to answer every thing and relate them to previous work experience as much as you can. After couple of days they offer me the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation when you took the initiative without anyone telling you.

title: Institute Associate Research Scientist IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online via the MDACC website.  2-3 weeks later I was contacted directly via email by one of the hiring managers (Scientists) of the group.   This initial interview was very pleasant and it was evident the manager had a strong interest in me as a candidate.  She mentioned she wanted me to speak with her colleague next.   About two weeks later, I had a second phone interview with the other manager of the group.  Again, another pleasant interview that included a mix of technical and behavioral questions,  but nothing out of the ordinary.  A week following this interview I was contacted by HR regarding scheduling an onsite all day interview, which included a 30min presentation on my previous research.  I was an out of state applicant and MDACC took care of all my travel and accommodations for the interview.   The onsite interview took place 3 weeks later and was a full day of one on one interviews and a group lunch with other Associate Scientists.  I had a great impression of the group and overall people were genuinely nice and seemed to love their jobs and MDACC.   Very positive experience despite it being a long tiring day!  The day ended with a one on one with the HR rep,  we discussed basic things, current salary, relocation, benefits, how I felt about the position, etc.  I expressed to her my strong interest in the position but also that I was fielding other offers so time was of the essence.   The next day following the interview, one of the hiring managers contacted me for references.    A little over a week following the interview, I received an informal job offer via phone call from HR and was offered the exact same salary I was currently making as well as a lower level Associate Scientist title due to my background.   Even factoring in negotiation room and the low cost of living in Houston, I was quite taken aback and decided to decline since it wasn't even close to being on par (25K less) with the other offers I had to decide between.
Interview Questions:
Are you comfortable working in a fast paced environment on programs that may or may not pan out?

Explain a time you encountered an obstacle in the lab and how did you combat that?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing is easy when you know someone on the inside. Be polite and show respect. It's a large institution so the probably met with a lot of people already. Repeat your name. Use "I" statements. Be honest about what you need practice in.
Interview Questions: How is your pipetting skills

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I want to clarify that I applied for the graduate nurse residency program with MDA. After closing the application online, they called within three days of submitting to do a pre-screening phone interview. They seemed to call people in waves as other classmates of mine were not contacted to schedule an interview for five more days. At the end of that initial phone call with pre-screening questions, the lady told me that they would like to schedule an in-person interview for the following week. They did not offer all applicants this in-person interview - a friend of mine did not get offered one. It was a panel interview with three individuals in similar departments. It was relatively laid back and they wrote down many of my answers to questions. I had prepared answers to many interview questions that I had looked up on websites like allnurses(dot)com.
Interview Questions: What are three important customer service skills you have and can you tell us about a time that you implemented one of them?

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted resume for consideration and was called back rather quickly by the human resource department to schedule an in person interview the following week. The following week, I met with the hiring manager and a few members of the team. Questions asked where the standard questions someone with a background in IT should expect. They seem to use the STAR format in interviewing candidates.

Was told the hiring process was going to take about a month, before they would schedule to select the final candidates that would be meeting with upper management. From there they would be making a hiring decision. It's been about a month and I never heard back from HR.

Normally I would had wrote a company off for lack of no response, however this is a major company in the Houston area with tons of staffing needs. I'll update if I ever hear back for those of you that are in the same situation.
Interview Questions: Know your background on the institution, and their mission statement. Focus on customer service, and be yourself in the interview and you will be just fine.

title: Research Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process isn't too bad. It was an overall good experience but inst very helpful on gaining knowledge of the position that you will be working, almost deceiving. The hiring manager is very pleasant on the phone, makes you feel comfortable answering questions. I enjoyed the interview process but the job is not overall what I thought it was going to be.
Interview Questions: Can you manage multiple tasks at one time and how do you go about doing so?

title: Public Safety Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: it was easy and time consuming. 1st interview with the sergeant then they send you to do a polygraph test and if you pass the pgh. you have to sit with 3 captains for an hour asking easy questions
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Services Coordinator -Bay Area Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Webster, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
This was for a PSC position at their Bay Area location off Nasa Rd in Clearlake/Webster.
I applied online on April 6th 2016. The next day I was contacted via email by HR. The email asked
"Why are you conducting a job search at this time?"
"What special skills experience can you bring to the table?"
"What are your salary requirements? (please provide a range)"
I responded right away and was contacted via email the next day to call HR to set up a face to face interview
The HR rep I called was friendly, & the interview was set up Monday,
There were 2 other people waiting to be interviewed when I arrived
Conducting the interview was a Business Service Manager and a Lead PSC.
The interview was relaxed, conversational. They had a list of questions they selected from.
They gave me an opportunity to ask them questions.
The emphasis was on compassion for their patients, customer service, working as a team and checking your attitude and being held accountable in all interactions.
They are looking for long-term team members, they want to invest in someone who can be dependable, tardiness is not tolerated they have limited hours and their patients are being seen for very serious life impacting issues. 

The hours aren't right for me.
Interview Questions: "Why are you conducting a job search at this time?"

title: Human Resources Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was first asked to come in and meet with hiring manager and recruiter. A second interview was scheduled with the director to which she came out to meet me close to my side of town so I would not have to drive to the med center again. After the interview they followed up within a week to hire me for the position and I started two weeks later
Interview Questions: I was asked questions specific to my skills and background. The questions were not difficult but this would vary for the type of role you are applying to

title: Internship Interview

Interview Descriptions: Great company culture that values and recognizes employees. Very thorough and clear hiring process. Recruitment was professional and available through out the entire process. Senior management is very humble and encouraging. Leadership encourages a healthy work/life balance.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX)

I was first interviewed one on one by a recruiter who was very friendly. Then I was interviewed by the manager of my unit-one on one. Nowadays, I hear that nurses can have a group interview. It just all depends.
Interview Questions: What made you decide to become a nurse?

title: Graduate Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by recruiter and scheduling the interview was quick and easy, done by appointment. Interview is with a panel of 3 (nursing director, nurse mgr, workforce leader). They were all very nice,  approachable, and easy to talk to which made the interview very pleasant and relaxed. They asked what seemed like maybe 10 questions, all behavioral. I was contacted 4 weeks later for a position.
Interview Questions: Talk about a difficult process that you experienced and how you made it easier and more efficient.

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (South Houston, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I was greeted by the PI, she stated she was very impressed with my credentials and would be hiring me immediately. (That should have been my first sign of her impulsiveness.) First RED FLAG!
Not sure what she was impressed with, I do not have a Bachelors or even an Associates degree. I am an average worker that technology has passed over. I took a short break in the field to raise my family and was not able to complete my previous community college courses. By the PI making this rash decision, the job was a nightmare, to say the least in the nicest possible way. My work environment was hostile and the research became unusable. Millions of research dollars were wasted!
This department boasted they are the richest department there at MD Anderson and have no regard for equipment costs.
Interview Questions: She didn't really ask me much. She gave the interview based on my resume, explained her department and I let her know what I was familiar with and what I was not familiar with. PI stated that was not a problem and that she would be showing me what I did not already know. I really wished I would have asked more questions of this PI and the supervisor. The supervisor had worked alone for  17+ years. I later discovered the why to this.

title: Professional Student Nurse Extern Interview

Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was a phone interview consisting of 1-2 questions. After that, I was scheduled for an in person interview the following week. The interview consisted of a panel of 4 different managers. They each asked about a question or so. I would say the interview was about 15-20 minutes. I was super nervous but they understood that and were super sweet.

title: Research Assistant I Interview

title: Graduate Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The Green Job online interview was very relaxed. Only 5 simple questions, like a pre-screening. Once selected for an in-person interview, the process is easy. My experience was two unit directors and one nurse manager. They each asked about three behavioral based questions. They informed me the decision process takes about 2 weeks. After 3 weeks I called to check my status. I was told that I was selected for the program but that they were waiting for a position to open up. After about 4 and a half weeks they called me the offer.

title: Clinical Studies Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I got an email to schedule a phone interview. During the phone interview the person talked about the job mostly. Then I got called back for an in person interview on site.
Interview Questions: What is you employment history?

title: Applications Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions:
3 months after applying online, I received a call to come and do the test. The test was a combination of math, logic and programming questions. Right after the 2 hr test, they sent me to meet the manager. This was a surprise, since I was not told that I will be interviewed the same day. In addition to meeting with the manager, the whole team was actually in the room. 
Interview was conducted by the manager and members of the team. What threw me off is that the atmosphere was rather casual and informal with seemingly very little 'structure'. That threw me off. I wasn't sure whether if I also responded by being casual I would fall in the some sort of trap, or if I responded by being more formal that I would be perceived as 'stuffy'.

I followed up and was told that I passed the test, but never heard back regarding the position. I feel that I wasn't given a fair chance since this was a surprise interview! I came to do the test, so, I didn't even have my own copy of the resume.
Interview Questions: Standard questions mostly. Questions about experience, projects done, to describe an ideal team...  What stands out was a question 'Why am I the perfect candidate for the company?'. Also, multiple (and I mean multiple!) questions unrelated to the position, but about whether I like to cook, what do I cook, do I like sports, which sports, who is my favorite athlete, etc...

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

Interview Questions: What is the present status of Immunotherapy ?

title: Research Data Coordinator Interview

title: Applications Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview with hiring manager first.  Standard get to know you kind of screen.  Nothing technical besides what was on my resume.  Second interview was granted but had to remind them to schedule it!

Second interview was a panel interview with prospective team members and manager.  More technical but not really anything in depth besides walking them through my experiences and some standard behavioral questions.

Was thrown off by hiring manager asking me for experience with technology not listed as required or preferred.  Of course I didn't have anything to add for that so, pretty much knew where I stood then.

Panel seemed friendly.  Was told I'd hear back regardless.  Still waiting ;)

title: Research Assistant Interview

2ND one with PI and other lab members. It went well as the PI wanted other lab members to know and understand me.

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: my interview was conducted by two faculty members who were proficient at their work and kn ew eaht they were looking for. the PI was present in the interview and asked very relevant and direct questions. I felt that they looked for honesty and skill both at the same time.
Interview Questions: tell us something about yourself

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Took about 3+ months to get a call for an interview. Be ready to be patient because it would take at least a month to review the application. You would get a phone call from a recruiter and get called in for an interview.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your weaknesses
What is your strength
Tell me about your past experience
What makes you a good candidate for the position

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds for the interview process. First round was meeting the hiring manager. Second interview was panel style and I had to give a presentation. Third round was the final round. I met with a panel of department executives and then a one-on-one with the VP of the department. Each round was fair. The process began in October 2015. To date, I have not received any confirmation of whether I received the job or not. I have only been told I am still being considered. Very frustrating since it is now March 2016. And I had to initiate finding that bit of information.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were typical.

title: MRI Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a panel of three. One of them was nice, respectful, and professional. The other two were confrontational, demeaning and unprofessional. Those that I described the interview to, seem to agree that they were testing me to see if I could handle the stress of being (literally) yelled at, belittled, and treated like an idiot. Obviously, I did fine, as I was offered the position. This is not sour grapes, folks. I wanted to work for them. I really did. But if there is any possibility that they treat their employees the way they treat their applicants, then I don't need that in my life. And if it was truly "a test", then at some point someone should have said, "Look, we know we were hard on you, and it was an uncomfortable position to put you in. But please understand that we have to make sure you can handle tough situations. And rest assured, that we DO NOT treat our employees in that manner." If someone had said that, either immediately after the interview, or during the offer process, I probably would have taken the job. But to date, that hasn't happened...even after explaining my reason for declining the job to HR.
Interview Questions: At one point they asked about the type of contrast that we use in my current position.

title: Senior Industrial Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: The HR department could not be worse; they are inefficient and incompetent.  The hiring process took orders of magnitude longer than it should have done, as a result, even after the hiring manager approved the hire.  The interview process was pretty standard by the hiring manager, departmental employees, and employees in other related departments.
Interview Questions: Describe process redesign projects that you've led in the past.  What was the problem, what were your process improvement interventions, and how did you quantify the resulting improvements (or lack thereof)?

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly simple. It was three different interviews, one over the phone and two panel interview.  My phone interview was with the hiring manager, my second interview with the team I would be working with, and my last interview was with the people I would be reporting to.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (League City, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter was welcoming and friendly. Panel interview on unit was with three people and exhausting. Lots of situational questions. No clinical questions. Unit tour and met staff. Beautiful unit. Great people.
Interview Questions: How do you view yourself in five years?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was working as an intern in the medical center. Saw the posting for postdoc at MDA and emailed my CV to the assistant professor (email id listed on the job posting). I got a reply from him the same day and we scheduled a meeting that week. After a brief chat about my previous work, in particular about my programming skills, he said I could join him.
Interview Questions: Something related to whether I understood associations among variables and also about clustering methods. The questions were easy though.

title: Social Work Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted via email about a month or two after submitting an online application. I had a panel interview with 4 people from the department including supervisors and a current social worker. I showed up 30 minutes early however was interviewed about 30 minutes late. 
Right after I had another "interview" with current social workers in the department..about 5 or 6...this was more laid back. About three weeks later i got an email saying i was not offered the position and to look for future opportunities.
Interview Questions: what would your supervisor say about you?

title: RA I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied through referral, then got a call for a phone screen. This was followed by an onsite interview with the hiring manager and the other important members of the team. This was followed by a long wait process. Then I got a confirmation of the job, it was hard to negotiate salary and this done over the phone.
Interview Questions: Describe your research experience? Why are you interested in research?

title: Senior Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews. First one was one on one with an HR department representative to get a general background and make sure you meet the minimum requirements. The follow up was a group panel interview with the hiring department where they ask you more specific questions. Questions were fairly standard.
Interview Questions: What are some relative experience positions that required you to be a part of a team?

title: Sourcing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was very easy but delayed. First interview with hiring manager(phone screen) and second interview was face to face. 

Very slow process, zero response from hiring managers or hr. 

Seems laid back environment and no respect for candidates.
Interview Questions: Basic behavioral questions

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the recruiter via email and told I was being scheduled for a phone interview with 5 different supervisors within the same department.  The interview was scheduled in a timely manner. Only 4 of the supervisors ere available.  The length of each interview varied from less than 5 minutes to 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: How do you handle disagreements with physicians?

title: Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Professional and informative. HR department can work a little slow at times. I have had several interviews in my department as I am a returning employee. Last interview with technologist position did have some awkward moment. Physical contact  with persons that are interviewing you should not happen. Can give the wrong impression. Was interviewed by 5 persons and two of the individuals were being very close with each other touching each other and smiling at each other.
Interview Questions: What are my 5 year plans.

title: Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
This was a specialty high skilled position in which the lab coordinator title is given and adjusted for a job in which the person who fills it won't take it unless the pay is there. For reference, this is a lab/research position.
Interview lasted from early morning to very late in the evening. 
Had 30 minute interviews with faculty/lab members. One of these interviews was with a highly emotional confrontational person who was irritated with my would be boss, and afraid that I would encroach on their territory. This person was not mistaken in their fears.
Interview Questions: What is Avogadro's number?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I sent my resume to practically everyone in the lab I wanted to work in months ago, I finally got an interview for a position and I have accepted the job.
Interview Questions: Describe your duties at your current position?

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to take an assessment about two months after I applied. Took the assessment and did a one-way online interview. Never heard back until I followed up with them several weeks later. I was informed that I was not selected.
Interview Questions:
What is the scope of your communications experience?
Why do you want to work for MD Anderson?
What are your salary requirements?

title: GN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Great interview process. Got an email and was asked to do a one way interview via webcam since I lived 5 hours away. Submitted and heard back within 48 hours!
I was then sent an email to take an assessment test. It was 70+ questions and waiting to hear my verdict. It was not hard at all.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose nursing as a career?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted via email by the administrative assistant one week after applying for the job to set up an interview. Had three 30 minute interviews with people in the department. Very laid back but formal interview process and also got a tour of the lab. The head of department asked difficult specific questions to test your educational knowledge.
Interview Questions: What do you know about cell apoptosis?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was surprisingly fast and easy. Got a call from HR about a week after I applied with a little phone interview just asking basic questions and giving a job description. Went to the interview in the hospital. It was a panel interview. Got an offer the next day.
Interview Questions: Why MD Anderson?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Put in application and waited months and didn't hear a word. People were being hired left and right but no word. Almost left the company because it took so long.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met with my (future) direct supervisor and the vendor who found me for the position. The interview was formal, but relaxed. I brought examples of my work and they came in handy. I had a great synergy with my supervisor right away and was awarded the position. It took a week total. When I re-applied for the job through MD Anderson (and not a vendor- as a contract position), it took 4 months for them to decide they were looking for someone with more experience.
Interview Questions: What kind of background do you have that relates to this job?

title: Research Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied in April 1st and i didnt get a call until May 28.I meet with two board panel members who were very nice.One even gave my resume to two other hiring managers just incase i didn't get that particular position.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview, not too tough, general questions. I was asked about 20 questions in 1 hour. Typical interview questions, study and practice before you interview. I was asked about 20 questions in 1 hour. Typical interview questions, study and practice before you interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line as directed. They want you to take some type of psychological test after you fill out your info. The test is so unrealistic. Be careful in how you answer these questions.
Interview Questions: I'm quite qualified for a position. The test questions are basically about how you relate to others in a work environment.

title: Research Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and interviewed within a week. The interview was relatively straight forward. It was a panel interview with Department clinic director and Department business manager.After the interview I met with the Director of research very briefly. Was offered the position in a week.
Interview Questions: Discussed my resume.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I've interview in 3 different departments for receptionist. Each interview was different. The first was a panel interview that consisted of the hiring manager, admin asst, 1 current receptionist, a psc, and head psc. It lasted about an hour and everyone was pretty nice and it was laid back. The second dept it was just myself and the hiring manager. The third department was another panel with the hiring manager, myself, and a nursing supervisor.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict in the workplace?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was formal but quiet friendly and It was great to talk about my passion with the interviewer that I found it to be common amongst the most workers there.
Interview Questions: they asked about my research experiences and why am I qualify for this position.

title: Operations Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews, varying in amounts of people in the included panel. Long gaps between each interview. Pays off in the end though. Very detailed oriented. The hiring process included me meeting the team I would be supervising, my future colleagues, and upper management up to the director level.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Senior Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 interviews over the course of about 3 weeks. First I met with my (now) boss, and the team/people I would be supervising. I came in later to meet with 2 clinicians I would be working closely with. Everyone was very casual and nice. They were more concerned with my ability to maintain the cohesion/closeness of the group, which I think is a good thing. It's a very supportive environment. People work hard, but they also act like regular people and weren't stuck up. I was SO nervous and very stressed due to a cross-country move and a dying pet, so these were NOT my best interviews. I was hired for a lower position than I originally applied for, but was told that if it goes well, there may be potential for promotion.
Interview Questions:
How would you handle a situation in which you did not agree with your supervisor? 
Why aren't you getting a PhD? 
Do you have plans to move/leave the area in the next 1-2 years?
What is your approach to supervising others?
What makes you qualified for this position?
Do you feel like you're a team player?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy, supervisors are easy to communicate with. Management made you feel comfortable while asking questions and were extremely nice. Department is very customer service based. I applied and 2 weeks later they called for an interview, after about a week later they offered me the position, two weeks later I had orientation.
Interview Questions: What is difference between HMO and PPO?

title: PSNE Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was on a panel interview with four judges. They asked me about my nursing experience, why I wanted to be a nurse, and about MD Anderson's values. Everyone was very friendly and nice. I left the interview feeling very good about it. They also did a phone interview before. However it did take about 2 weeks to hear back from them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a nurse?

title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very nice hospital. Brought me on an asked general questions about my recent jobs. Explained to me about company and wanted me to ask them questions if I was unsure.
Interview Questions: What was your worst job?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (South Houston, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got the call days later. Went into interview with a panel. A Practitioner, PSC Lead and three PSCs, was very laidback and comfortable. Be assertive and sure of yourself. If you are not qualified do not interview for this position.
Interview Questions: Why MD Anderson of all the medical centers in Texas

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied on line and received a call the same day to set a up a time for telephone interview. Interview was conducted by a panel 4 days later. The interview was average with a group of managers and techs.
Interview Questions: explain a liver protocol

title: RN Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: My interview process was very very good experience. I received a call within one week of my interview to offer me the job. I had a interview with the hiring manager and with some of the staff nurses.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to do pediatric oncology?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Smithville, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done by the Professor which I ended up working for. He was not prepared with specific questions. He was a nice guy and pulled my interest to the lab. He showed me the lab and introduced me to the lab manager and the post-doc. They were very nice and didn't really interview me, they mostly chatted about the research I'd be doing.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses? 
Why do you want to work here?
They then asked me about my resume.

title: Receptionist International Center- Bilingual English/Arabic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process was lengthy. By the time I was contacted about interviewing and then actually interveiwing with the hospital was about a month. First I was contacted by email and a telephone interview before getting a 1:1 with IC and then finally a week or so later had a group panel interview.
Interview Questions: How did I become about applying to the position.

title: Institute Associate Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward interview process which involved phone interview(s) then on-site visit.  HR representative seemed a bit "off" and not well organized.  Everyone was pleasant and professional.  Hiring manager was pleasant however unprofessional post-interview.
Interview Questions: Really had no difficult/unexpected questions

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
I did a phone interview/screening with HR.  Then was contacted for a web interview which lasted less than an hour.  6 weeks passed and I received a call from HR asking to meet with me when I am there next week for my in person interview - but nobody called me about an in person interview.  The confusion was sorted out the next day, but there was no flex given in dates as an agenda for 2 days of interviews was already set up (I was coming from out of town) even though I was only given a weeks notice.  

The disorganization got worse.  I showed up 10 minutes before my appointed time, but was told that I was given the wrong agenda and was over an hour early.  During my time there, my agenda was revised 5 times.  There was no person appointed to coordinate my interviews, I relied on the receptionist to provide instructions on how to get to different locations.  There was large gaps between appointments, but the building is isolated, so would end up having to go sit in a lobby for up to 2.5 hours at a time.  The majority of the interviews were not back to back, so I had to kill time between.  

Some of the folks were fantastic and I enjoyed talking to them and some had not read my resume or the job description (there were multiple vacant positions being recruited for, so they didn't know which job I was there for).  However, with no one that was coordinating, there was nobody to check in with at the end of the 2 days. The whole thing felt very disorganized and as if the department was not unified and functioning as a team.
Interview Questions: Physicians that wanted to know what the others had told me (engage in gossip type behavior, not job specific information).

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was inconvenient in that I had to come in multiple times to meet with people. It was stressful because some doctors asked "normal" questions but one doctor asked me "off the wall" questions.
Interview Questions: How well could I proofread

title: Research Statistical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: A full day - 30 minutes sessions with various team leaders, senior analysts, department chair, and program director. I also had lunch, which was more casual, with a couple of analysts. The day started with HR in a separate building. After I accepted the offer I had a drug test, and not one but two tuberculosis tests. As an employee you are highly encouraged to get a flu shot, but this is not required since the department is separate from patient care areas. The on-site flu-shot clinic is stunningly efficient - gone in 60 seconds and a free lollipop.
Interview Questions: What statistical methods do you have experience with?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back recruiter contacted me did quick phone interview setup panel interview following monday received offer that wed submitted background check same day received offer did other screening following week
Interview Questions: Name a time you made a mistake how did you resolve it

title: Patient Escort Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: They ask 10 basic interview questions. Four people interview me . It was a long wait before interview. Also drug test etc was all done in same day . The interviewer are very nice about letting you know the career advancement you can have with company . They let you know how there finding cures and different grants they have for school if u wanted to futher education.
Interview Questions: They ask about your last employer and would you recommend them to anyone else to work there .

title: Accounting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: There were 7 persons who sat in for the interview process and each one asked a question.  They were all very friendly and made you feel comfortable.  I was nervous at the beginning but once I started answering questions I felt better.
Interview Questions: Why would I want to work at MD Anderson

title: Stationary Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Bastrop, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Hard to get a interview had to apply 4 different times over two years before getting a interview.  After 2 different interviews, 4 hours total. I never heard back from them.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you currently do at your job?

title: Research Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by an in person interview with the supervisor and Principal Investigator on site. Then they showed me around the department. Very laid back and went smoothly. Getting around the hospital can be confusing if it is your first time so come early to figure out where you are going
Interview Questions: explain more about your resume

title: DISC Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Past employee, quick turn around, knew at end of interview.Met the group during and got some insight.Interview was pretty straight forward, but the job description includes a whole lot more than what was able to be discussed.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: CT Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy, you meet with a panel of people some that are from the department and some that are not. They ask you questions about your resume and want you to elaborate. The staff that is from the department ask you questions like what's the most patients that you have ever seen in a day. Reason is they like to brag about how many patients the department sees every single day.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was OK, i had some issues with some of the questions. I guess what surprised me the most was that there were going to be 5 people in the interview, that were interviewing me. NO one told me  how many people would be interviewing me.
Interview Questions: Describe who you are?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a short interview at one of the cafes here. We went over my past experience and his expectations of postdoctoral fellows in his lab. I was treated to lunch with the lab mates.
Interview Questions: They asked me if I could work 6.5 days a week.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: First you get interviewed by HR then you will get sent to the research team. There was an Interview panel of PI's, coordinators and managers. Everyone was professional and respectful. Everyone had great questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years from now?

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a team interview. They all were very nice and inviting. They seemed to care about work-life balance. They asked a lot of questions about previous work experiences. The team wanted to know how familiar I was with medical terminology. They also told me about how closely I would be working with doctors which wasn't the case after I was hired.
Interview Questions: If I would be ok with the shifts.

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back but hard process. Very nice people but very determined to be great place. Would recommend this place. Location is also in the medical center. Research is also a good option.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job.

title: International Patient Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by manager 2 months after applying online. Applied for the same position multiple times previously without being interviewed. Scheduled a 1 on 1 interview with manager directly for 2 days after (this is rare, you should expect apanel interview) I was honest and comfortable during my Interview which is why I aced it.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you made a mistake at work

title: Manager, Parking & Transportation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: First interview was in front of a panel of 5 members. Second interview was in front of a panel of 4 members. Third interview was one-on-one with the Hiring Manger. Fourth and final interview was with the Hiring Manager's boss. Two days after the fourth interview, I received and accepted the job offer.
Interview Questions: Questions were behavior-based. Tell me about a time you disagreed with your boss. How did you handle it?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4+ months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process for me took 4 months. I first interviewed in August, and later heard about a second interview months later. They had lost my resume, and the staff involved with my information had transferred to a different unit. I finally was given an offer in December, and my start date was 3 days before the end of the year.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with difficult participants/people?

title: Cell Therapy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Everything moved very fast. Applied for the position, was invited to take personality assessment 4 days later. Was invited via email for in person interview 2 days after that. Got the job offer 2 days after the interview. Very casual interview, no scary questions or pressure. Gave me a nice tour and treated me well during the whole process.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in leaving your current job?

title: IT Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Hour interview with managers, then an hour interview with peers.  Common questions that you might expect.  It was round robin for question and answer.  Had an opportunity to give my background in the beginning.
Interview Questions: How to communicate to stakeholders

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Writing/editing test and multiple rounds of interviews. Everything is coordinated through HR. The HR department is huge, and it can be hard to get in touch with the right person. They're very efficient if they're in a hurry to fill the position though.
Interview Questions: What's your biggest weakness?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The hiring of MD Anderson is slow. HR is not quite on top of their game. After applying you will receive an email to test for the position.  If you pass, and the department has received your resume, you will then receive an email or a call from HR informing you the department would like to interview you.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength? What is your biggest weakness? Describe a time you had to deal with a difficult person, what was the outcome? Be prepared for situational questions.

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Group panel, discussion with team you would be working with if hired, going over resume and job description, talking about how your past experiences would be helpful in this future one, discussing study you would be hired for
Interview Questions:
Describe your strengths and weaknesses pertaining to this job?

Why do you feel qualified for this position?

How would you deal with rowdy participants?

Describe how you got out of a difficult situation in the past.

title: CPRIT/CURE Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position over an online database with many different levels of application submissions. This included a CV, recommendation letters, an academic transcript, and several essay questions. After receiving my acceptance, there were many forms to complete as well as drug examinations/vaccines.
Interview Questions: Why should we pick you?

title: Medical Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was 2 interviews, one with the night shift manager and one with the day manager. The night manager are more nervous. The questioning has a lot of pauses because they are just following a questionnaire form. The day manager follows the same form however they had more of a conversation with you. There will be 3 people in the room at each interviews. Besides the manager will be 2 coordinators which also have a say in decision making so make sure you look at all of them instead of just concentrating on the manager who is the main interviewer. Do not ask about vertical movement within the lab in great detail. I feel I did not receive the job because of my questions and need for promotion.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected the usual questions. Have you had a time where you disagreed with a fellow lab tech. disagreed with a order given. ever overcame something. how you deal with stress.....

title: Outpatient Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: A one on one interview was conducted by the nurse manager. A few staff members were then invited into interview me as well to ensure that I would be work compatibly with current staff.
Interview Questions: Describe your work ethic?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume through a department director I met at a reception and was scheduled in for an interview a couple weeks later. Had an initial interview with the administrative director and and director, then another round with the department chair.
Interview Questions: To explain work on a project I did that relates to something I would do for a project here.

title: Manager IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed more than five years ago. It took over 10 days after I applied only before I received a call. I then completed the telephone interview and had an in-person interview within a few days. Within the week, I had a series of 30 minute interviews with IT Directors within whom the position would interact. These were scheduled all in the same day. It took about 8 days to go back and forth with the job offer and getting detailed explanation of benefits.
Interview Questions: The one thing that surprised me, pleasantly, was how well my (then future) Director and I hit it off. What was scheduled as a one hour in person interview went on for four hours. We got into details wireless network designs with blueprints. I never expected that in the interview.

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: One interview, about an hour long.  The questions were an extension of the HR interview.  Know your behavior in situations and if you have relevant work experience, being able to pull from past experiences should not be to hard.
Interview Questions: The  questions were personally answered.  How have you handled your own mistake.

title: Associate Scientist I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview with HR followed by phone interview with hiring manager. Invited for an interview. This consisted of meeting with 8 or so individuals in the program and a 30 minute presentation of my own research to 10 or 15 individuals. Interviews weren't difficult at all, presentation was a little nerve wracking but a good experience.
Interview Questions: Why aren't you in grad school?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: We need to fill huge amount paper works. And need to wait almost half year for the H1 Visa. Because the HR is very low efficient.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just wanna say the hire process could be really long....by the time you may hear from them may take over 1-2 years....and the gap between interview and hire date could be...2 months...half year......But overall it worth the pain!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as a new graduate nurse and went through the nursing recruiter.  I set up an interview with the associate director of the floor and did a panel interview as well as toured the unit and was able to ask the other nurses on the floor about the job
Interview Questions: I cannot think of anything right now, but it was something like describe your most difficult moment and how you overcame it

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: skype, interview with colleagues and PIs, visit labs and talk to people, skill set introduction, refer letters, talk to previous PIs, applied online and get to know publications and grant application, english in writing and speaking
Interview Questions: experience and tech skill set

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Very organised and systematic process with people helping me at every bit of the interview. They made  me feel at home and luckily I was asked very comfortable questions.
Very organised and systematic process with people helping me at every bit of the interview. They made  me feel at home and luckily I was asked very comfortable questions.
Interview Questions: Will I be able to bring something new to this workplace ?

title: Research Data Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sat down with my immediate supervisor and their boss. We went through the job description and what makes me qualified for the position. Then the physician I am working for now entered the room. They went over their expectations for the job and asked a few questions.
Interview Questions: There wasn't a questions that really stood out for me. Everything was straight forward.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Smithville, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview (I was living in a different continent at the time), followed by an invitation for a formal interview. I had to give a 1 hour seminar on my previous research, which was visited by at least 5 professors of relevant disciplines. After defending my research, I had personal interviews with 3 professors, where it was most important to show understanding and interest for their research subjects as well as my own. I had 1 day notice of who these professors would be. Otherwise there were a few informal parts, like a meeting with the postdoctoral association for lunch, and a dinner with the future boss to which I was bringing my family. A huge 1 day undertaking.
Interview Questions: Very challenging science questions, but nothing unexpected for a Postdoctoral Fellow

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied though online process, received offer for internship
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: met with HR first and then group panel interview with 5 people. HR felt more like a casual conversation and the group panel interview they have a standardized sheet with questions to ask each candidate.
Interview Questions: what are 3 strengths?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: externship, then 1 internal interview
Interview Questions: why did you choose MD Anderson?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with PI, department head, then toured the laboratory. Interviews took about 30 minutes each and consisted of questions about my résumé: experience and skills. Very friendly, but formal.
Interview Questions: What do you know about biology?

title: Research Statistical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: hiring manager was checking my experience
Interview Questions: they checked my previous experience. It seems I was the good fit.

title: New Grad Nurse Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 rounds of interviews. First round is with recruiter over the phone and the second round is with a panel over video. The questions are behavioral types that asks about your experiences for both round. The recruiter is extremely nice and helpful and quick to respond to emails and questions. They call from an unknown number so pick up all calls if you applied online.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to sacrifice yourself on a job.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went smoothly.  When I was waiting for a callback, there were some bumpos in the road.  We had to wait for HR to interview additional candidates. Once I had the offer, everything was fine.  The background check was extensive and completed well before my start date.
Interview Questions: All of the questions were pretty standard for any interview.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions:
Send email to professor and was invited to give a scientific presentation.
And talked with PI and colleagues for future research projects.
Interview Questions: If your proposed idea didn't work out, what will you do next?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Got the email from school, and applied online for this position. I received email for interview after 5 weeks. Interviewed just one time at MD Anderson Cancer Center. Received a phone call after 3 days. Paper works took about a month to be done.
Interview Questions: There wasn't unexpected question

title: Case Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews. Recruitment, Department heads, then department workers.
Interview Questions: Conflict resolution

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very Long process
Interview Questions: None really they just asked about my experience, when I will finish school and about certifications.

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very short interview with Department hiring manager. Basically, I was interviewed by the head of the Department , Business manager, and other colleagues from the center.  After a short presentation, I was shown the Department and facilities and explained the type of clinical work they performed in the Facility and was asked a few questions about experience doing the work.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience in specific field.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: A Research Supervisor was at the University of Houston job fair. I spoke to her briefly about the research they were conducting and the opportunity they were offering. I gave her a printed copy of my resume that I had prepared. I followed up with an email stating my interest another copy of my resume, cover letter, and research work sample.
Interview Questions: What is my previous work experience? what do I intend to gain?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Different for new graduate nurses compared to experienced nurses/internal transfers. Uses Behavioral interviewing which can be studied on youtube for good prep. Usually a panel interview. It is not okay to say you want to work at MD Anderson for the benefits. That makes everyone write you off and not want to hire we. We want passionate people do make cancer history. I have participated in interviewing in the past.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work at MD Anderson.
Describe the most critical patient you have cared for.
Have you ever worked with someone that was difficult? How did you handle it?
Describe a quality improvement project you have participated in.

title: Clinical Research Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and heard back from the department I applied to very quickly and set up my interview.  The campus is very large and very easy to get lost and traffic in the area can be very bad. I was almost late to the interview due to being lost on campus so anyone applying should plan to arrive very early!  There are plenty of nice areas to sit and relax and get coffee if you arrive too early for your interview.   Once I arrived to the department I had an interview with all of the supervisors at the same time.  They let me know that if I wanted the job I could contact HR.  I went to HR and they did not know I was there that day (apparently I was supposed to stop there first before going to the department but I was not told this on the phone) but they took care of me and I got an offer letter via email the next day.  There were several visits to HR after to fill out paperwork, meet with employee health and there was a 2 week institutional orientation.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work there.

title: Department Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was:  (1) first interview was telephone interview  (2)  second interview was interview with immediate manager (3) third interview was with team I would be working with (4) fourth interview was Head of Department
Interview Questions: Reason for wanting to leave current poistiion

title: Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: You'll have 2 interviews. One with a panel of  at least five different people who've worked for the company minimum of ten plus years. Finally you'll interview with the unit manager and director.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to provide for MD Anderson Cancer Center?

title: Research Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: I initially interviewed with HR, which was fine, and then met with the PI. Meeting with the PI was very informal.
Interview Questions: They asked specific questions on what techniques I have mastered.

title: Patient Access Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by HR and interviewed that same week. My interview was pleasant and went well. I am still in the interview process
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions

title: Behavioral Science Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: There was a long waiting process of not knowing what was going on, being said, etc.  I didn't train myself for the interview, and everything went well.  I would encourage others to just be themselves.  I remember feeling tricked when HR called and made the offer...because they also include the cost they pay for insurance as part of your salary....so, you really feel like you're getting more.
Interview Questions: Not in this interview, but I was asked once in an interview, "describe a time when you failed and how you overcame that failure."

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: My application was screened by HR before being sent to the individual hiring for the position.
