That individual contacted me first via e-mail, then via phone for a preliminary phone interview, and then arranged for a 1:1 interview for the next week. The process was very straightforward and very simple; parking was validated, great directions were given and my questions were answered extensively.
Interview Questions: The manager was hiring for two positions simultaneously--the Research Assistant II position, and a Senior Research Assistant position. He told me he had a candidate with slightly less experience, but with a higher level of education who was also interviewing for the position and said he wanted to hire both of us, but wasn't sure if he should hire the other candidate to the more advanced position, or if he should hire me to that position. He asked me for my opinion as to whom he should hire for which position (i.e., what would I do were I in his shoes doing the hiring?)

title: Senior Statistical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: PHD candidates are invited to make a presentation around one hour and then talk with different faculties as well as principal analyst.
Interview Questions: Any interaction with biologist

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Getting feedback, return calls or any info from HR is non existent.  Even for employees applying inside, the hiring process is fragmented and lengthy.  Hiring managers must call nurse recruting and HR frequently and assertively. Little feedback and no response are common.
Interview Questions: None

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I circumvented MD Anderson's standard process by sending my CV directly to the PI.  I feel like my PI also wanted to circumvent the typical hiring process due to its inconvenience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Conference Planner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted an online application and took an online assessment related to work style.  Soon afterward I received a call from the department (within 2 weeks) asking me to interview for the job. The interview was with 3 people and was a pleasant experience.  We talked for about an hour, and I learned a great deal about the job, including the challenges.  I was expecting to receive an offer and was surprised when I did not.  I am pretty sure I was considered over-qualified for the position.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were especially difficult.  The interview was more like a conversation.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (New Brunswick, NJ) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: You have to log in in their website www university of texasmdandersoncancercenter .com then apply and submit resume.If they will choose you,  a nurse recruiter will call you and schedule your interview.
Interview Questions: Nothing really, it's all related to your work experience ex; what is your best achievement  as an RN and Why? describe an instance in your job  that you should have done better and  regretted doing  it.

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I don't remember when I applied, but the whole interview process from the initial call to the job offer took exactly one week. I was called Wednesday, completed a phone interview Thursday, had a panel interview Monday and received the job offer Thursday. The panel interview was not intimidating.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you helped a coworker..

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Recruiters did not even want to talk to me as I am a white male. I found out that of the two jobs I interviewed for, the only candidates that were initially presented were young minority females, and generally friends of recruiters.
Recruiter was rude, discourteous, and incompetent - she completely forgot to inform me that my sign-on day was cancelled as the entire HR department was out of the office at a 'team building event'. I witnessed many of them coming back to the office that afternoon clearly intoxicated, stumbling. No apology was offered.
Interview Questions: Not a question, but the iPEP personality testing was bizarre.

title: Student Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted by HR over the phone and scheduled an interview. Later met in the med center to talk to an HR representative. The representative was very friendly and asked many different questions before referring me to the department for an interview. I shuttled over to the correct building on the other side of MD Anderson's campus. The following interview was with two women, the project director and the head physician/ researcher. The interview went great and i was asked questions in spanish as well to prove I was bilingual. Overall, the interviewers were friendly and thorough as they asked many questions. I was made an offer later that week!
Interview Questions: Describe previous experience.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Directly interviewed with Director/Chairman/Professor
Prepared 30 min talk on research projects
Plan the whole day for the interview (including meeting the team, lunch/dinner with the professor and team)
Have a plan what you are going to work on
Preferentially have a fellowship otherwise plan to apply for fellowships
Be on time, it takes some time to get from one place to the next
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Scientific Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: First was a round of fairly easy but time-consuming tests (IQ test, personality test, editing test, etc.), just me and an HR monitor, who mostly left me alone. After completing those, I met with an HR rep, who conducted a very brief interview, mostly asking my salary requirements and explaining the time frame for the next stage. I received a call a day or two later asking me to meet with several editors in the department. First I had to go to the main HR office to get a visitor badge, then take a shuttle to the appropriate building. I met with my potential immediate supervisor, then her supervisor, and was introduced around to the rest of the staff. The interview was mostly to see whether I would fit in with this tight-knit group of coworkers, and was overall very laid-back. There weren't really many traditional interview questions.
Interview Questions: Who is the current CEO of MD Anderson?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: applied online for GSBS PhD in Nov 2011. got the interview invitation in Jan 2012. onsite interviewed one day by five faculty members in Feb 2012. each 1:1 interview lasted about 30 mins. very nice people.  not many technical questions. they just introduced the department/research/life in MDA to me. that's all about the interview. no telephone interview. got the offer about two weeks after interview and accepted it.
Interview Questions: introduce yourself, talk about your previous research projects

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had to fill documents online, get my foreign degree accredited, and submit my resume and cover letter through the portal system. Phone Interview with Scientist who hired me, followed by one-is-to- one interview.
Interview Questions: What are your long and short term objectives ?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions:
First, I found the ad. I sent my C.V via e-mail. After 1 week, I received an email for the invitation for the on-site interview. PI asked my previous experiences and future goals for about 40 mins.
Mostly, PI asked about my previous papers and sets of skills. He also explained his research and what kind of persons he looking for filling in this position.
Interview Questions: Can you do animal work?

title: Research Statistical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: on site, there are 5 different faculty members talking with you.first apply online, then get the interview. some faculty asked you theoretical questions, some ask you about your research projects. they regard the research part more.
Interview Questions: self-introduction

title: Senior Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Excellent phone interview - Recruiter was thorough, friendly, candid and professional. Top Notch!  The in person interview was very professional. All people I had contact with were upbeat and pleasant and seemed happy to be there. Met with two managers. One was very personal, engaging, shared more about the direction of the organization, its culture, existing challenges,  and asked questions that solicited a dialog. The other manager was very professional and pleasant.  Her interview was more structured with an "agenda" and filled with "behavioral" questions, some of which were challenging to answer.  She was more of a "by the book"  type personality and she was harder to get to know on a more personal, candid level.  Overall my experience was very positive and I hope to move to the next step!
Interview Questions: Give a recent example of how you used creativity to do your job

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: Email notification to come in for in-office interview.
Interview Questions: Give a situation where you have overcome difficulties in a team setting.

title: Human Resources Generalist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with HR types and several client facing interviews.  Panel was mostly made up of peers.  Clients gave me good insight into the culture of the company and how the organization perceived HR at the time.
Interview Questions: What is the biggest mistake you have ever made and how did you recover?

title: Media Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: They required website application first. they required some personality and work capability test on the website. After the first screening with the CV they asked me to send them my portfolio.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to move here?

title: Research Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The lab manager called me after accepting my application via iHireBiotechnology.com. As I was not in Houston at that time they gave a couple of weeks of time to plan my trip. The interview was setup for Monday afternoon and was pretty straight-forward, 

The post-doc I was to assist talked to me at length about my resume, future plans, etc. Was very informal. He showed me around the lab and introduced me to some other lab members. They said they'd get back to me in a week's time and like they said I was offered a job by the end of the week.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were based on my past experience. Nothing technical, just general personality questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple behavioral interview.
Interview Questions: None.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: It is pretty straightforward - meet with future mentor, discuss career goals, talk to lab members, finally go for lunch with the new boss.
Interview Questions: What are you planing after completion of this training

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: The entire process moved incredibly slow.  I had to be very proactive to chase down people in the HR department when I found job postings in which I was interested and applied.  There was a lot of red tape to get through the application process, and ultimately I was not ever considered for any position for which I actually applied.  I was placed in a pool of highly qualified applicants and was subsequently considered for a position that wasn't even posted.
Interview Questions: How would you handle difficult personalities?

title: Medical Physics Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview includes a whole day on-site interview, which lasts 2 hours. Meet with 5 faculty members. The questions range from personality questions, technical question to the career goal question
Interview Questions: What tools are available if you're not sure about your annual QA measurement?

title: Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
HR was first by phone. Scheduled an interview with them first and on the same day saw the manager
Manager spent about an hour with the manager and her director. 
Panel consisted of about 5 people including the educator.
Nurses in the unit met with 3 nurses on the night shift.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions only. Situations you have to explain. How you handle conflict? How you moved a process along? Your role in teams? How many people have you managed. Have you educated in the past. Tell me about your background. Do you mine working the night shift? Why or why not. Tell me a time you had to deal with a difficult co-worker.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Step by step:
1 - Find a department/professor who might be interested in hiring a postdoc
2 - Send the CV and wait
3 - Interview: prepare a presentation of current/latest research and papers
4 - After the presentation, being questioned about the research goals
5 - Having good publications+clear future direction = offer

Offer takes at least a couple of months since the paperwork is very slow at MDA.
Interview Questions: What is the short term plan to get an external grant?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Short interview, basic questions about employment, skills and interest.  Reviewed benefits package, information about the institution and department. Toured the campus and had lunch with other managers.  A few group interviews were done with current teams.  Questions regarding interests and previous experiences were asked.
Interview Questions: What are your goals

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview discussing my skills and time-frame of work. Then a in-person interview where we discussed my plans after work and my previous research experience.
Interview Questions: Why not medical school?

title: PhD Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: After for PhD in UT Houston GSBS, get a invitation for the on site interview. GSBS pay for the hotel and ticket, the interview last for a day. Have 1 on 1 chat with five professor from the department. They asked about regular resume question and research done in the past. Offered the position two weeks after the interview.
Interview Questions: regular resume question and research done in the past

title: Safety Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews.  multiple interviewers.  I've been on worse.
Interview Questions: simple career inductry questions. dont fret.

title: Information Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews over a 2 month period.  I gave up twice on waiting for a call back but eventually got them.  All interviews were non-intimdating but quite probing.  The background check is very extensive.
Interview Questions: What is my job as a manager?

title: Patient Escourt Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: It's was simple I came in then the supervisory of the department interviewed me he was nice we talked about football for 15 min. The interview was about 30 min after he said someone will call you in a couple of weeks now it's been almost two and I'm starting to worry.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had well over 10 interviews with different stakeholders in five different departments. Gave me the ability to clearly understand who I would be working with, who would be easy to work with and who would not. Interviewed 1-1 with three people in two rounds and with two panels with three people in one and four in the other.
Interview Questions: Have you ever been in a situation where you were directed to do something shady by your boss and how did you handle it?

title: Research - Statistics Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Their in-house recruiter called me after I applied on-line.  She was pleasant, confirmed a couple of items and asked a few questions, said I looked like a strong candidate then said they'd forward it to the department that would do the hiring.  She didn't really ask about my skills for the job per se (it's a specialized field and she wouldn't know what to ask, being the general recruiter).    Heard absolutely NOTHING from them since (2+ months ago).   I don't know if they hired someone else, decided not to hire me, are still deciding, had budget cuts and can't hire, or what.  No idea how far they went to check references, etc.  either.   No contact at all after them saying I looked like a strong candidate.   It's very time-consuming to enter all employment history and details on-line and then frustrating to hear nothing!
Interview Questions: "Why did you leave your previous job?"

title: Executive Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Excellent executive recruitment process.  Very hands on and proactive.  Helpful with networking, cultural tips, etc.
Interview Questions: How have you been effective in a matrix organization?

title: Proposal Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing went well because it was with an autonomous group who could make demands on HR. Multiple face to face interviews.
Interview Questions: Do not recall any difficult questions.

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication with the company was very positive, the HR rep was very professional. Email was used to schedule the interview and to correspond with me.  I did receive a phone call to confirm the appointment.  I interviewed with the HR consultant first and then I interviewed with the department administrator.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation if you were told to redo a project after you have completed it?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for two positions over 6 years and landed both. Each required two interviews that were pretty easy going. The work environment is pleasant and very professional. Once hired, an entire day of orientation will be provided with a huge amount of information on every aspect of a huge institution.
Interview Questions: No difficult question

title: Radiation Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions:
At the time I submitted my resume the radiation therapy market was not as saturated as it is now. 
The MDA HR department and recruiters were very responsive but I was referred by an employee in a leadership position.
The interview was a panel type interview which can be intimidating. 
Make sure you answer the questions correctly, know your job expectations, and the MD Anderson culture. Try and connect with at least two people in the panel.
Be prepared to work in a large department.
As a whole the therapy team are excellent,  and caring individuals with a high level of integrity all working for the patients. As in any large group there are a few lazy people who skate by under the radar.
Interview Questions: Asked about setting patients up and how I would  handle difficult immobilizations

title: Research Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: I talked with someone from their group as they passed by my area and expressed an interest in the job. It took a long time to get me to interview, I am not sure why. Then the transfer was delayed due to needs of the unit I was leaving.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions were asked.

title: Research Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions:
Interviewed with director and research nurse
talked about my experience
was asked about dealing with doctors
asked about handling catching up on load of work
asked about how to deal with difficult people
told about one of the projects I would be dealing with

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: As a postdoc, I only get interview from my boss's group. People sit together listen to my presentation, asking questions. Nothing different from ordinary seminar. I did a good job and my research direction suits my boss's lab well. So i got the offer. But the paperwork process really took me a long time.
Interview Questions: what's your plan in your career?

title: Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I had two interviews with the hiring department, and I was very impressed with their high standards, with the work environment and with the professionalism of the individuals I met in the hiring department. 

The process was very intricate: From start to finish, I took 3 online Hogan assessments, three paper and pencil tests, and two personal interviews. 

M. D. Anderson is very big on personality assessments. I, on the other hand, am not a fan of them. They asked questions that were offensive to me and had no relation whatsoever to the job. Why should an academic department care if I would like to try scuba diving or whether I felt unloved by my parents as a child? It's none of their business! I have a real problem with psychological testing, obviously. Why is that? It's because I do not like people peering into my brain and drawing conclusions, not telling me what those conclusions are, then basing an employment decision on those conclusions.  It would be only fair for them to discuss those conclusions with me and give me a chance to say, "Yes, that's right," "No, that's wrong," or "Yes, that used to be true of me, but here is how I have addressed it/ grown from the experience." Though this practice is legal, I think it is unethical. Ask yourself if you want to submit to this type of examination and live with the outcome.

Aside from the psychological assessments, the other tests and interviews were easy, and I felt completely at ease completing them. I do not feel that the interviewers' questions were particularly insightful or probing.

Now, six weeks after the interviews and tests, I have yet to hear back from M. D. Anderson. I sent a thank-you note and a follow-up inquiry. After all that effort on my part, they did not have the courtesy to respond with a "thanks but no thanks" letter. Sadly, that is the way of the world these days.
Interview Questions: Would I like to try scuba diving? Would I like to try mountain climbing?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: it is easy process. First is HR 1:1 interview, then your manager. Manager ask more about technique questions.
Interview Questions: all question are reasonable and not difficult

title: Sourcing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with an HR phone screen, then the hiring Manager phone screen, then an onsite interview with Manager and Director.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current position?

title: Managing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was called by a headhunter and provided a resume. I did a video interview, and that led to a trip to Houston. I spent the morning with the head executive in the business unit for which I wanted to work.  3 hours of pointed questions about my experience and productivity.  In the process we seemed like minded and had simialr professional and organization philosophies and goals.  Went home with an expectation of an offer.  Recruiter said UT system politics resulted in the offer of the position to a family member of a high up UT insider.
Interview Questions: Your resume shows impressive volume of productivy.  Tell me why the quality of that productivy was also impressive?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at MD Anderson Cancer Center (Houston, TX) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: I first contacted the director of the program I was interested in.  When I was not first offered an interview, I asked to start volunteering 2 days a week (8 hours total).  After about 2 months, a position opened up, and I was the first on the list.  The interview was really a formality, as they were impressed with my work ethic and I got along well with all of the members in the lab.  Stay persistent and motivated!
Interview Questions: What are your career goals, and how are they in line with the mission of MD Anderson Cancer Center?
